channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Reginald Dwayne Betts discusses King's jail letter's impact on him in prison and his post-release life, including founding Freedom Reads to build prison libraries.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Q & A
channel.desc: Former Newsweek editor and managing editor of CNN Worldwide, Mark Whitaker, author of The Afterlife of Malcolm X, discusses the life and legacy of the Black nationalist leader, who was assassinated in 1965.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Historic speeches of former U.S. presidents as well as their policies and legacies.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Author Melissa Klapper discusses the diary of Jewish American Emma Mordecai who lived in the South before and during the Civil War.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: U.S. Senate
channel.desc: A highlight from a recent Senate session.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: History of Tariffs
channel.desc: Professors Douglas Irwin, Sharon Ann Murphy and Eric Rauchway discuss how the federal government historically has implemented tariffs and how they have impacted the economy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Edward Dolnick, Dinosaurs at the Dinner Party
channel.desc: Author Edward Dolnick talks about the early 19th century paleontologists who discovered fossils, huge bones and coined the term dinosaur.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This report on the January 1968 activities of President Lyndon B. Johnson includes his State of the Union address, North Korea's seizure of the naval surveillance ship USS Pueblo, and the Tet Offensive in Vietnam.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Teaching African American History
channel.desc: Linda Salley, teacher and President and Executive Director of the African American Museum of Bucks County, Pennsylvania, discusses the importance of teaching African American history.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture Centennial
channel.desc: Simon and Schuster, CEO Jonathan Karp and Hachette Book Group CEO David Shelly discuss how they are guiding their companies through a period of rapid change in the book industry.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1986 U.S. Patent and Trademark Office film, hosted by actor Ossie Davis, highlights the work of minority inventors and the patents they hold.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Martha Blanding & Tim O'Day, Groundbreaking Magic
channel.desc: Martha Blanding breaks a color barrier at California's Disneyland, becoming the park's first black official tour guide in 1971, joining the high ranks among Disney cast members as employees are known.

channel.title: Public Affairs Events
channel.desc: Public affairs events, congressional hearings, speeches, and interviews.
